paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR-Thr45 mutation associated with amyloid cardiomyopathy, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloidosis characterized by prominent cardiomyopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In transthyretin (TTR) a new mutation (TTR-Thr45) has been identified in a patient with familial amyloidosis characterized clinically by prominent cardiomyopathy and the absence of peripheral neuropathy.
allele-specific oligonucleotide hybridization both in the patient and in fixed heart tissue from his aunt confirmed the base change.

functional_data.summary: The mutation results in an abnormal tryptic peptide in the patient's TTR.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR-Thr45 mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical presentation and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was confirmed in both the patient and his aunt.
key_quotes: The TTR-Thr45 mutation is a new variant TTR found associated with cardiomyopathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene and its variants were successfully extracted.
